IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: The Foundation was formed to be a vehicle to receive, manage, and distribute all private donations, restricted and unrestricted, for the benefit of the School District of Springfield R-12, Springfield, Missouri.
IRS990.MissionDesc: The Foundation was formed to be a vehicle to receive, manage, and distribute all private donations, restricted and unrestricted, for the benefit of the School District of Springfield R-12, Springfield, Missouri.
IRS990.Desc: Grants were awarded to various Springfield Public School elementary, middle, and high school classrooms for Back to School needs as well as other projects related to technology, curriculum, etc.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: 97 scholarships were awarded to deserving students within the Springfield Public School system for post-secondary education tuition.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Part IV, Line 2b: Explanation of escrow account liability
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The Foundation receives and holds money from various advertising rights agreements between Springfield Public Schools and local area businesses. Local businesses agreed to give money to Springfield Public Schools to help renovate existing sports facilities around the city in turn for advertising on facility grounds over a period of several years. The Foundation holds and invests the money for Springfield Public Schools until they request it, typically at the time their debt payment becomes due related to refurbishing the sports facilities.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Part V, Line 4: Intended uses of the endowment fund.
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Endowment funds are invested at Community Foundation of the Ozarks and Central Trust Company with the purpose of long-term growth to provide for scholarships to students of Springfield Public Schools and also to provide for future grants for various needs of the Springfield Public School district.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Part XI, Line 2d: Other revenue amounts included in F/S but not included on form 990
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Direct F/R expense netted on 990 $27239 Direct donor benefits netted on f/s $-6642

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Part XII, Line 2d: Other expenses and losses per audited F/S
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Direct F/R expenses netted on 990 $27239 Direct donor benefits netted on f/s $-6642

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Grantmaker's Description of How Grants are Used
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Teachers complete standard grant applications which must be approved by the principal. In the case of high impact grants that fund more than one school, each school's principal must approve the application. The grants go before an allocations committee made up of foundation board members and volunteers. Grants are sorted by grant category and are then ranked and funded by the position they are ranked. The board approves all final grants. Teachers have final grant report forms which must demonstrate the outcomes and show how the funds were spent. Any deviation of funds spent must first be approved by the Foundation. In some cases, there are site visits from the Foundation. Scholarships are also reviewed and awarded by the scholarship committee which includes two representatives from the district.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 11b
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The form 990 will be reviewed by the executive committee prior to filing. A copy of the 990 will be provided to all board members for comments and questions prior to filing.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 12c
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The Foundation regularly and consistently monitors and enforces compliance with the written conflict of interest policy as a part of board meetings and retreats. Follow up with individual board members is completed as necessary.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 15a
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The Foundation's executive committee performs an annual review of the Foundation's staff and recommends an appropriate level of compensation based upon performance and comparable data. This process is approved and documented in the Foundations's minutes.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, Line 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The Foundation's governing documents, conflict of interest policy, and financial statements are available for public inspection at the Foundation's office. An annual report is prepared and circulated throughout the community.
